subject: p12189285
Findings: Comparison is made with prior study. There is a new left IJ catheter with tip in the mid-SVC. There is no pneumothorax. Moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly is stable. Moderate-to-large bilateral pleural effusions have increased with increasing bibasilar atelectasis, larger on the right side. Mild-to-moderate pulmonary edema has worsened. Right central catheter tip is in the right atrium. The appearance of the sternal wires is unchanged. Patient is status post CABG.
